plentry.pd: Event handler for . See .

App ID issued by Agora for your project. Only users under the same App ID can join the same channel and communicate with each other. An App ID can only be used to create one instance. To change the App ID, you must call to destroy the current instance and then create a new one.
On Windows platform, this parameter is the application window handle. After setting, it allows connecting or disconnecting video devices while the device is powered on.
Channel profile type. See .
License used for authentication when joining a channel. Charges are based on the license.
Audio scenario type. Different scenarios use different volume types. See .
Connection region. This advanced feature is for scenarios with regional restrictions. Supported regions are listed in . Area codes support bitwise operations.
Thread priority for SDK general threads. See THREAD_PRIORITY_TYPE.

pd.ph: Whether to use the EGL context in the current thread as the root EGL context for the SDK. This context is shared by all EGL-related modules, such as camera capture and video rendering.

ul.li: : Use the EGL context in the current thread.
: (default) Do not use the EGL context in the current thread.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable domain restriction:
: Enable domain restriction. Suitable for IoT devices using IoT SIM cards to access the network. The SDK only connects to servers in the domain or IP whitelist reported to the carrier.
: (default) Do not enable domain restriction. Suitable for most common scenarios.

Whether to automatically register Agora extensions when initializing :
: (default) Automatically register extensions.
: Do not automatically register extensions. You need to manually register using .
Event callback handler. See .
Context object of the Android Activity.

App ID issued by Agora for the project. Only users with the same App ID can join the same channel for audio and video calls. An App ID can only be used to create one instance. To change the App ID, you must call to destroy the original instance before creating a new one.
Connection region, applicable in scenarios with regional restrictions. Supports bitwise OR operation to combine multiple region codes. See .

Channel profile type:
CHANNEL_PROFILE_COMMUNICATION (0): Communication scenario. Agora recommends using the live broadcasting scenario for better audio and video experience.
CHANNEL_PROFILE_LIVE_BROADCASTING (1): (Default) Live broadcasting scenario.
CHANNEL_PROFILE_GAME (2): Gaming scenario. Deprecated since v4.x.x. Use CHANNEL_PROFILE_LIVE_BROADCASTING instead.
CHANNEL_PROFILE_CLOUD_GAMING (3): Interactive scenario optimized for low latency, suitable for frequent user interactions. Deprecated since v4.x.x. Use CHANNEL_PROFILE_LIVE_BROADCASTING instead.
License used for channel connection verification. Billing is based on the license.

pd.note: Before using this enumeration, you must call to check whether the audio device supports ultra-low-latency capture and playback. To experience ultra-low latency, ensure that the audio device supports ultra-low latency (isLowLatencyAudioSupported = ).
pd.ph: Audio scenario type. The volume type used by the device varies in different scenarios:

ul.li: AUDIO_SCENARIO_DEFAULT (0): (Default) Automatic scenario. The SDK selects the appropriate audio quality based on the user role and audio route.
AUDIO_SCENARIO_GAME_STREAMING (3): High-quality audio scenario, suitable for music playback.
AUDIO_SCENARIO_CHATROOM (5): Chatroom scenario, suitable for frequent role switching or microphone mute control.
AUDIO_SCENARIO_CHORUS (7): Real-time chorus scenario, suitable for users with good network conditions and high requirements for ultra-low latency.
AUDIO_SCENARIO_MEETING (8): Meeting scenario, mainly for transmitting voice.
AUDIO_SCENARIO_AI_CLIENT (10): AI conversation scenario (AI client only), only applicable when interacting with agents created using Conversational AI Engine.

plentry.pd:
Whether to automatically register Agora extensions when initializing the :
: (Default) Automatically registers extensions.
: Does not automatically register extensions. You must call to register manually.
List of extension library names.
instance. See .

Log configuration. See . By default, the SDK generates 5 SDK log files and 5 API log files:
SDK log files include: agorasdk.log, agorasdk.1.log, agorasdk.2.log, agorasdk.3.log, agorasdk.4.log
API log files include: agoraapi.log, agoraapi.1.log, agoraapi.2.log, agoraapi.3.log, agoraapi.4.log
Each log file has a default size of 2048 KB and uses UTF-8 encoding.
The SDK writes the latest logs to agorasdk.log or agoraapi.log.
When agorasdk.log is full, the SDK deletes old files in order and renames them to generate new log files.
agoraapi.log follows the same rollover rules.
Thread priority type. See ThreadPriorityType.

pd.note: Applicable to manual SDK integration. Not applicable when integrating via Maven Central or JitPack. Ensure the directory exists, otherwise initialization will fail.
pd.ph: Directory where .so files are stored. This directory must be a valid private directory of the app and can be obtained via Context.getDir.

ul.li: After setting this parameter, the SDK loads .so files from the specified directory to enable dynamic loading and reduce package size.
If not set or set to null, the SDK loads .so files from the default compiled path, which increases the package size.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable domain name restriction:
: Enables domain name restriction. Suitable for IoT devices using IoT SIM cards. The SDK only connects to domains or IPs registered in the carrier whitelist.
: (Default) Does not enable domain name restriction. Suitable for most general scenarios.
